comments.content:
BTW, more samples to come during the weekend.   
For now, a small hint: this face is distributed by a very well-known 'indie' foundry.   
You won't find this font at MyFonts, though.

Yes, it's Caligrafia de Bula.   
Congrats, Adriano.

Been away for the whole weekend, here's a new thing to dig   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010062204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26594.gif)

Huh, nothing yet?   
   
 ![2](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010062204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26743.gif)   
   
Different glyph, same face.

Yup, that's it!   
BTW, my first sample was Alfon's 'g'.
It's the Portuguese based language typophile attack! 13 posts from Brasil & portugal on a row.

That wouldn't be [Friday Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010062204/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/11261.html?1056569919) by yours truely would it? No, it is covered in cobwebs somewhere on my hardrive, but it made me smile to see that form.   
   
R
We haven't got a CLUE what that is.
Other than a binocular g, that is. Correct?

Sorry for delay ;D   
   
Franz, this is not by Goudy!   
Randy, this reminds a litle bit of Friday, but no!   
Yeah Grant, you correct! this is a binocular g!   
Jack, not Lisboa from Ricardo Santos!

Sorry Tiff, no by Alias!   
(... and a Happy Birthday ;D ;D)

This is really hard... This type is a freeware Lacuna designed by Peter Hoffmann and distributed by Floodfonts in 2003... Now, the font is no more present in the collection... I think the type is under update process...   
   
See the font here...   
 [http://www.typemotion.de/\_magazin/typographie/freeandgood/lacuna.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010062204/http:/www.typemotion.de/_magazin/typographie/freeandgood/lacuna.html)   
   
But... a new challenge is comming... ;D
This is going to kill me -- I know I know that one!

Liar! That has to be a g! :-)   
   
Uppercase [G](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010062204/http:/www.generalmills.com/corporate/) then?   
Script lowercase s?   
Is that some kind of crazy capital blackletter F?   
   
Hmmmm...
Doh! Gotta be a lowercase y.

Yeah Omine!   
This is a lw "y"!   
   
But ;D What the font?   
Easy ... hahaha
It's not a Tiro font, is it? The [website](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010062204/http:/www.tiro.com/) is in limbo.

Not from Tiro.   
This typeface is distributed by a foundry currently located in Europe.
Is it a typeface that debuted at ATypI last year?

No...   
But the designer of this typeface did have a strong connection with the ATypI conference.
